transcription.text: Welcome to Zoom. Enter your meeting ID followed by pound. Enter your participant ID followed by pound. Otherwise, just... You are in the meeting now. There is one other participant in the meeting. Good afternoon. This is Jim. Bear with me here. Certainly. How you doing, sir? I am very well. How are you? I'm good. I'm pretty well for Friday. Thank you. Excellent. Excellent. Am I coming through okay for you? We just moved, Jim, and I'm still working on the technical pieces, so I'm not sure this is my first kind of Teams or Zoom call. You come through just fine, just fine. Okay, excellent. Awesome, awesome. Yeah, so I want to show you around PC Recruiter today. And before I share my screen and kind of show you around, just wondered what were kind of the main features you need or what are the main things you need the software to do, be it ours or anyone's? Jim, to give you some background in terms of, you know, with where, what I'm looking to do, and ultimately, you know, I have been in the corporate world for a while. And I've used from, I guess I would call it a larger scale or enterprise level usage and pretty familiar with a few different tools, applicant tracking tools to, you know, within that environment. And so I'm kind of in a bit of a transition period in my career right now where in the purpose for reaching out to you and initially through Jim is that I'm looking to kind of hang my own shingle and have been doing that, working in that direction and a crazy time to do it, but ultimately in terms of place individuals in different organizations, but also looking to do business development. And so in tracking all of that, Jim, so, you know, I've had some conversations and with a few folks, one of those being John Busey, who knows Jim Wise, I guess they know each other pretty well. I think you, I have mentioned that to you in the past, and they go back a number of years. Part of what I'm using primarily right now is LinkedIn Recruiter, LinkedIn Recruiter Lite, some clearance job efforts, but then also just the good old-fashioned other avenues and social networking, a little bit of that, but primarily networking as well. I would consider myself an old school recruiter. I've learned some of the newer things that are out there through maybe some AI enhancements or tools, chat GPT, that sort of thing. I wouldn't consider myself by any means an expert at those, but kind of learning as I'm going. But really trying to grow this, doing so, I expect to make a decision, Jim, on PC Recruiter or another platform within probably the next four to six weeks at the top end. And that may be a little bit slow, but just wanting to get things moving forward. Just at this time, kind of getting things adjusted, getting my ducks in a row, for lack of a better term, and getting things moving in terms of the business itself. Sure, sure. And certainly happy to answer any questions you have to help you. Sure. So let me show you what I'm seeing right now, Jim. Now, that may grow. So you have a lot of flexibility in how you access the system. There's a mobile app as well, so you can access it remotely too. So you're going to have a username and password.
